episodes.description: Yuji and Kento continue their battle against Mahito, who develops his powers in unexpected ways.

episodes.title: Kyoto Sister School Exchange Event: Group Battle 0
episodes.description: In the aftermath of the battle with Mahito, both sides have returned to their usual routines. Yuji finally goes back to school, but his surprise return doesn't exactly go over well with his peers.

episodes.title: Kyoto Sister School Exchange Event: Group Battle 1
episodes.description: Itadori Yuji and the rest of Tokyo Metropolitan Curse Technical School engage into their team battle against their sister school from Kyoto. However with the entire Kyoto team against Yuji, will he be able to last with his short training?

episodes.title: Kyoto Sister School Exchange Event: Group Battle 2
episodes.description: Aoi Todo and Itadori Yuji continue to battle it out, with the former determined to strengthen his new best friend. Meanwhile, Panda discovers Ultimate Mechamaru's secrets while showing a more powerful side of him during their battle

episodes.title: Kyoto Sister School Exchange Event: Group Battle 3
episodes.description: Miwa and Maki engage in a battle of strength while Nishimiya tackles Nobara. The battle is interrupted by Mai and the twins battle it out revealing secrets about their clan.

episodes.title: Sage
episodes.description: Megumi and Noritoshi confront their similarities and differences through battle. However, the Goodwill Event is suddenly upheaved by a sudden invasion!

episodes.title: Black Flash
episodes.description: The special grade cursed spirit Hanami has invaded the Goodwill Event! Can the students survive the onslaught and escape the curtain with their lives?

episodes.title: Nonstandard
episodes.description: Yuji and Todo continue their battle with the special grade curse. Satoru finds a way to enter the battlefield.

episodes.title: Jujutsu Koshien
episodes.description: After the events interruption, the school tournament continues with a baseball match.

episodes.title: The Origin of Blind Obedience
episodes.description: Megumi, Nobara, and Yuji are sent out to investigate the mysterious deaths connected to the Saitama Urami East Junior High. Meanwhile, Mahito and Geto continue their schemes, incarnating one of the Cursed Womb: Death Paintings.

episodes.title: The Origin of Blind Obedience - 2 -
episodes.description: The battle begins, and the group is split. Fighting a familiar foe, Megumi uses a new technique, and reflects on his past. Nobara and Yuji fight Cursed Womb: Death Paintings Kechizu and Eso.

episodes.title: Accomplices
episodes.description: The Cursed Wombs: Death Paintings, Eso and Kechizu, face off against Itadori and Kugisaki--however, the two begin to rot after they're bathed in the blood of Eso and Kechizu.

episodes.title: Hidden Inventory
episodes.description: Year 2006. Sorceress Utahime and Mei Mei are investigating a Western-style mansion that has a history. Suddenly, the building begins to collapse and they are thrown into the air.

episodes.title: Hidden Inventory: Part 2
episodes.description: Gojo and Geto are assigned the task of guarding and erasing a "Star Plasma Vessel" Riko Amanai when two groups try to get rid of her.

episodes.title: Hidden Inventory: Part 3
episodes.description: Gojo, Geto and Amanai rescue Kuroi. They then set off together to the island of Okinawa. However, back in Tokyo, the group is ambushed by somebody with only one goal - to prevent the fusion of Riko Amanai and Tengen.

episodes.title: Hidden Inventory: Part 4
episodes.description: "Let's go home, Riko-chan." The moment Geto extends a hand to Amanai, the worst that could possibly happen does. Geto is left dumbstruck as Toji Fushiguro makes his appearance. Toji then declares that he killed Satoru Gojo.

episodes.title: Premature Death
episodes.description: Gojo becomes the strongest and starts handling missions alone. Geto feels lost while tirelessly exorcising and absorbing cursed spirits until another sorcerer appears, spreading her ideology on Geto.

episodes.title: It's Like That
episodes.description: After finishing a mission one day, Itadori decides to go to the movies, Kugisaki decides to go shopping, and Fushiguro goes home. After parting ways Kugisaki is approached by a woman who suddenly asks if she was with Itadori.

episodes.title: Evening Festival
episodes.description: The fight between Mahito and Mechamaru continues. A few days later, on October 31, 2018, an unknown curtain is cast over Shibuya. The people trapped inside repeat only one thing: "Bring Satoru Gojo."

episodes.title: The Shibuya Incident
episodes.description: Satoru Gojo enters Shibuya. The fight between the strongest sorcerer and the most evil curses begins. Meanwhile, Yuji works with Mei Mei and Ui Ui in order to get Yuji to be Gojo's backup as soon as possible.

episodes.title: Shibuya Incident - Gate, Open
episodes.description: The battle between Gojo and the cursed spirits continues and reaches a climax with an unexpected arrival.

episodes.title: Pandemonium
episodes.description: Gojo has been sealed in the Prison realm. It's time for the three sorcerer groups to enter Shibuya, save entrapped civilians and rescue Satoru Gojo.

episodes.title: Seance
episodes.description: Team Nanami regroups with Yuji and formulate a plan to rescue Satoru Gojo. Yuji, Megumi and Takuma encounter a sorcerer capable of contacting the dead.

episodes.title: Dull Knife
episodes.description: The curtain preventing the sorcerers from entering Shibuya Station is finally lifted and the teams can continue their rescue operation. However, with Ino heavily injured, Yuji and Megumi must split up. Nobara encounters a curse user.

episodes.title: Red Scale
episodes.description: Yuji finally arrives at Shibuya Station, but is met with unexpected opposition.

episodes.title: Fluctuations
episodes.description: As Mei Mei approaches Shibuya Station, Kenjaku meets her midway and calls out a special grade disease curse that she must defeat. Meanwhile, Naobito, Nanami and Maki encounter a curse.

episodes.title: Fluctuations - Part 2
episodes.description: Nanami, Maki, and Naobito are driven to the edge after the Special-Grade Cursed Spirit, Dagon, activates his Domain Expansion. Fushiguro gives them a glimpse of a way to escape death, then Toji intrudes upon the fight.

episodes.title: Thunderclap
episodes.description: Megumi is overwhelmed by Toji's pure power as he attacks the young sorcerer. Meanwhile, Panda and Kusakabe get entangled in the battle between Jogo and Sukuna.

episodes.title: Thunderclap - Part 2
episodes.description: In a desperate situation, Megumi forces Haruta into an unbeatable exorcism ritual against the out-of-control Mahoraga, his strongest shikigami, but Sukuna intervenes to ensure his plans with Megumi go on without any problems.

episodes.title: Right and Wrong
episodes.description: Yuji regains control of his body, only to witness the damage caused by Sukuna's merciless rampage. Meanwhile, Nanami, badly injured and delirious, confronts a group of transfigured humans and reunites with a familiar foe.

episodes.title: Right and Wrong - Part 2
episodes.description: Yuji and Mahito's fight continues. However, Yuji is unaware that Mahito has already divided into two beings, one of which is battling Nobara elsewhere. He intends to use her to permanently crush Yuji's spirit.

episodes.title: Right and Wrong - Part 3
episodes.description: Yuji's determination falters when Mahito attacks Nobara, but just as things appear bleak, Yuji's best friend arrives, reigniting his spirit. Now all three go beyond their limits as they fight to kill.

episodes.title: Metamorphosis
episodes.description: Mahito's fight against Yuji and Todo continues. Thanks to everything that happened during his battle with these sorcerers, Mahito finally discovers the true nature of his soul and takes on a new deadly form.

episodes.title: Metamorphosis - Part 2
episodes.description: The Shibuya incident is coming to an end and many groups of jujutsu sorcerers are getting ready for what may happen next. Meanwhile, Yuji's victory over Mahito is short-lived as the two are confronted by the mastermind behind everything.

episodes.title: Shibuya Incident - Gate, Close
episodes.description: The Shibuya Incident comes to a close. Yuki and Geto argue over their ideals of cursed energy. A long awaited sorcerer returns to the cursed filled Japan to execute.

series.title: Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba
series.description: A family is attacked by demons and only two members survive - Tanjiro and his sister Nezuko, who is turning into a demon slowly. Tanjiro sets out to become a demon slayer to avenge his family and cure his sister.

episodes.title: Cruelty
episodes.description: Tanjiro Kamado's life gets turned upside down when he finds out that his family was murdered by demons.

episodes.title: Trainer Sakonji Urokodaki
episodes.description: Tanjiro and Nezuko head for Mt. Sagiri per Giyu Tomioka's urges. On their way, Tanjiro encounters another demon.

episodes.title: Sabito and Makomo
episodes.description: Sakonji Urokodaki starts training Tanjiro for Final Selection, the test for joining the Demon Slayer Corp, an organization that has been hunting demons since ancient times.

episodes.title: Final Selection
episodes.description: To pass the Final Selection, Tanjiro uses the techniques he learned from Sakonji Urokodaki and begins his fight against a demon on Mt. Fajikasane.

episodes.title: My Own Steel
episodes.description: There are only four swordsmen left come dawn of the seventh day and they are issued Demon Slayer Corps uniforms and messengers crows.

episodes.title: Swordsman Accompanying a Demon
episodes.description: In uniform and with a sword in his hand Tanjiro continues his main quest to find the demon who murdered his family.

episodes.title: Muzan Kibutsuji
episodes.description: With Tanjiro backed into a corner by demons its Nezuko's turn to attack and prove that she no longer needs her brother's protection.

episodes.title: The Smell of Enchanting Blood
episodes.description: Two demons, Tamayo and Yushiro come to Tanjiro's rescue. Tamayo guides Tanjiro and Nezuko to her house where Tanjiro learns how to return demons to humans.

episodes.title: Temari Demon and Arrow Demon
episodes.description: Two demons, Tamayo and Yushiro come to Tanjiro's rescue. Tamayo guides Tanjiro and Nezuko to her house where Tanjiro learns how to return demons to humans.

episodes.title: Together Forever
episodes.description: With Tamayo coming to Nezuko's aid the battle reaches its climax. Tanjiro learns about the Twelve Demon Moons organization.

episodes.title: Tsuzumi Mansion
episodes.description: Tanjiro heads to his next location southeast; on the way he meats Zenitsu, one of the swordsmen of the FInal Selection.

episodes.title: The Boar Bares Its Fangs, Zenitsu Sleeps
episodes.description: Tanjiro gets separated from Zenitsu when he enters a mysterious house where he encounters another demon.

episodes.title: Something More Important Than Life
episodes.description: Inside the mysterious house, Tanjiro battles Kyogai - The Drum Demon while Zenitsu tries to bring Shoichi to safety.

episodes.title: The House with the Wisteria Family Crest
episodes.description: After defeating Kyogai, Tanjiro steps outside where he spots Inosuke who is eager to fight him. After a short tussle Tanjiro, Inosuke , Nezuko and Zenitsu head to a manor where they are taken in by an old woman.

episodes.title: Mount Natagumo
episodes.description: Tanjiro heads to his next location to a mountain northwest and he brings Inosuke and Zenitsu with him. Upon arriving on the spiderweb swarmed mountain Tanjiro and Inosuke soon run into Demon Slayers entangled in spider webs.

episodes.title: Letting Someone Else Go First
episodes.description: Tanjiro and Inosuke head farther up the mountain while battling Demon Slayers trapped by spider webs. Soon they find out that the Spider Demon family is behind it all.

episodes.title: You Must Master a Single Thing
episodes.description: Zenitsu finds himself alone in the woods where he encounters a spider with a human face. Despite being terrified he does his best and manages to defeat the spider human using a new technique.

episodes.title: A Forged Bond
episodes.description: High up on the mountain Tanjiro and Inosuke face off against Father Spider Demon, one of the Twelve Demon Moons (or at least they think so).

episodes.title: Hinokami
episodes.description: Inosuke confronts his savior. Zenitsu lies still near his death. Tanjiro faces what seems to be an unstoppable enemy, and in a moment of desperation, recalls his past.

episodes.title: Pretend Family
episodes.description: With his life flashing before his eyes Rui remembers the family he created. Meanwhile, Shinobu arrives on the mountain to stop Rui's older sister.

episodes.title: Against Corps Rules
episodes.description: In his final moments, as he perishes to ash and dust, Rui tells the story of how he came to be, his family and the family he created.

episodes.title: Master of the Mansion
episodes.description: With the battle reaching its conclusion Tanjiro and Nezuko arrive at Demon Slayer Corps headquarters where their bond is tested once again.

episodes.title: Hashira Meeting
episodes.description: Ubuyashiki, the head of the Demon Slayer Corps, finally appears before Tanjiro. While revealing that he'd like to allow Tanjiro and Nezuko to join the Corps, the Hashira are unable to accept this decision right away.

episodes.title: Rehabilitation Training
episodes.description: The injured Tanjiro, Zenitsu, and Inosuke are sent to the home of the Insect Hashira, Shinobu Kocho, for treatment. Two weeks later, Tanjiro and Inosuke start rehabilitation training.

episodes.title: Tsuguko, Kanao Tsuyuri
episodes.description: Tanjiro, who has been going through rehabilitation training at the Butterfly Mansion, works hard to keep up his Total Concentration Breathing all day long.

episodes.title: New Mission
episodes.description: As Tanjiro and the others are devoted to their rehabilitation training, the absolute master of the demons, Muzan Kibutsuji, gathers the lower ranks of the Twelve Kizuki.

episodes.title: Flame Hashira Kyojuro Rengoku
episodes.description: Rengoku Kyojuro the Flame Hashira begins to solve the case of the deaths in the Mugen Train.

episodes.title: Deep Sleep
episodes.description: Tanjiro (with his sister in tow), Zenitsu, and Inosuke meet Kyojuro inside the train where they fall into a deep sleep thanks to Enmu's magic.

episodes.title: Should Have Been
episodes.description: The effects of Enmu's blood demon art become clear, making the protagonists face their individual, inner struggles. Tanjiro desperately looks for a way to negate the spell.

episodes.title: Insult
episodes.description: Tanjiro manages to break free from the demon-art dream. He finds Enmu, and the battle begins. Enmu reveals a more holistic, sinister agenda behind his actions, placing the demon slayers into a sticky challenge.

episodes.title: Move Forward!
episodes.description: The battle with Enmu continues as Inosuke, Zenitsu and Rengoku awaken from the spell. Tanjiro and Inosuke try to pinpoint the demon's weak spot, while the others focus on protecting the passengers in the train.

episodes.title: Akaza
episodes.description: Tanjiro has finally slashed Enmu's neck with the help of Inosuke. The fighting causes the train to derail. As silence deepens, a mysterious figure approaches from behind.

episodes.title: Set Your Heart Ablaze
episodes.description: Akaza continues to offer Rengoku the chance to become a demon to improve his skills. Rengoku refuses his offer and tries his best to keep up with him. The Flame Hashira has one goal: to protect his comrades even if it costs him his own life.

episodes.title: Sound Hashira Tengen Uzui
episodes.description: Following the death of Kyojurou, Tanjiro visits the Rengoku residence to deliver Kyojurou's last messages to Kyojurou's brother and father. Four months later Tanjiro, Zenitsu, and Inosuke are tasked with visiting an Entertainment District along with the Sound Hashira Tengen Uzui.

episodes.title: Infiltrating the Entertainment District
episodes.description: Led by Sound Hashira Tengen Uzui, Tanjiro, Inosuke and Zenitsu disguise themselves so they can get hired in the Entertainment District.

episodes.title: What Are You?
episodes.description: A mysterious Oiran is creating havoc in the brothels, but who is she?

episodes.title: Tonight
episodes.description: Tanjiro and Inosuke further continue the investigation even after Uzui's disapproval of their participation in the mission.

episodes.title: Things Are Gonna Get Real Flashy!
episodes.description: Tanjiro continues to fight Daki and starts using Hinokami Kagura instead of Water Breathing. Tengen saves one of his wives who had been stuck in Daki's belt. Inosuke, Zenitsu, and Tengen's other wives fight the belt demon.

episodes.title: Layered Memories
episodes.description: As the fight between Tanjiro and Daki continues, Daki causes immense damage to the district resulting in Tanjiro turning berserk due to rage.

episodes.title: Transformation
episodes.description: As Nezuko rushes to aid Tanjiro during a critical moment, her appearance begins to gradually take on a demon form as she sustains Daki's attacks.

episodes.title: Gathering
episodes.description: Putting Nezuko to rest, Tanjiro, along with Inosuke and Zenitsu, rushes to Uzui's aid, against his battle with the Upper Six Demons- Gyutaro and Daki.

episodes.title: Defeating an Upper Rank Demon
episodes.description: Gyutaro evades Uzui and goes after Hinatsuru. Tanjiro and Uzui rush to save her, but Daki's obi blocks their way.

episodes.title: Never Give Up
episodes.description: Tanjiro wakes up to find himself surrounded by burning debris with Gyutaro laughing delightedly at his plight.

episodes.title: No Matter How Many Lives
episodes.description: In the battle aftermath, Tanjiro and Nezuko search for the others. Suma pleads for Tengen to live, and Nezuko helps him. Tanjiro smells their scent and sees the demons arguing viciously. Gyutaro recalls his past.

episodes.title: Someone's Dream
episodes.description: All the Upper Rank Demons assemble at the Infinity Castle after Upper Six Demons' defeat. Meanwhile, Tanjiro heads to the Swordsmith Village.

episodes.title: Yoriichi Type Zero
episodes.description: When Tanjiro, who heard about the existence of a secret weapon from Mitsuri, was exploring the mountains, he stumbles upon Muichiro and a boy of the village arguing over something.

episodes.title: A Sword from Over 300 Years Ago
episodes.description: With Kotetsu's guidance and training, Tanjiro learns a new ability to understand Yoriichi Type Zero's next movements. During the training, the mechanical doll is broken by Tanjiro revealing a sword from more than 300 years ago.

episodes.title: Thank You, Tokito
episodes.description: Hantengu's head is slashed by Muichiro, and he splits into two clones. Muichiro is blown away by Karaku. Tanjiro, Nezuko, and Genya are stunned when the clones split into more clones. Muichiro rescues Kotetsu from a Goldfish Demon.

episodes.title: Bright Red Sword
episodes.description: When a group of Goldfish Demons attacks the Swordsmith Village, Mitsuri's crow informs her about the attack. Mitsuri heads to the rescue of the village.

episodes.title: Aren't You Going to Become A Hashira?
episodes.description: After beheading three clones, Tanjiro stumbles upon Genya who has beheaded Aizetsu but has now changed in appearance. Genya recalls his past.

episodes.title: Awful Villain
episodes.description: Genya entrusts Tanjiro with the task of beheading Hantengu. Tanjiro swings his sword at the fleeing demon, but an unknown demonic entity emerges behind him.

episodes.title: The Mu in Muichiro
episodes.description: Muichiro, with the help of air blown by Kotetsu to him, escapes Gyokko's Water Prison Pot. Muichiro finally recalls his tragic past.

episodes.title: Mist Hashira Muichiro Tokito
episodes.description: Muichiro faces off against Gyokko once again with a new Nichirin sword he received from Kanamori.

episodes.title: Love Hashira Mitsuri Kanroji
episodes.description: As the battle with Zohakuten intensifies, Mitsuri also develops a demon slayer mark on her neck. Just like Muichiro, the power she gains as a result is tremendous, and she's able to overpower Zohakuten for a while.

episodes.title: A Connected Bond: Daybreak and First Light
episodes.description: Tanjiro, Genya, and Nezuko chase the real body of Upper Moon 4. Tanjiro soon realizes, that the difficult choices are the toughest to make, especially ones with emotion.

episodes.title: To Defeat Muzan Kibutsuji
episodes.description: The Hashira have been summoned to the Ubuyashiki Mansion for a Hashira meeting.

episodes.title: The Sorrows of the Water Hashira, Giyu Tomioka
episodes.description: Tamayo is invited to the Demon Slayer headquarters - even though she is a demon. Meanwhile, Tanjiro, who is recovering at the Butterfly Mansion, receives a letter from Kagaya.

episodes.title: Fully Recovered Tanjiro Joins the Hashira Training!
episodes.description: After talking with Tanjiro, Giyu is able to overcome his past self and decides to join the training. Meanwhile, Tanjiro's wounds have healed enough to join the training, and he heads to his first training with the former Hashira Uzui.

episodes.title: To Bring a Smile to One's Face
episodes.description: Tanjiro continues his participation in the Hashira Training. Following his impressive performance in basic fitness and stamina drills under Tengen Uzui's guidance, Tanjiro advances to the next stage of training led by Muichiro Tokito.

episodes.title: I Even Ate Demons...
episodes.description: Tanjiro faces grueling training under Obanai Iguro's harsh tutelage. Pushed beyond his limits, he must overcome trials set by the jealous Obanai before meeting Wind Hashira Sanemi Shinazugawa and Genya, navigating their strained dynamic.

episodes.title: The Strongest of the Demon Slayer Corps
episodes.description: After completing Iguro and Sanemi's training, Tanjiro heads to Himejima's training site deep in the mountains with Zenitsu.

episodes.title: Stone Hashira Gyomei Himejima
episodes.description: Tanjiro pushes the boulder with Genya's help, collapses from exhaustion, and earns Himejima's respect, leading to a personal conversation.

episodes.title: The Hashira Unite
episodes.description: During a silent night when the moon shines, Kagaya finally meets Muzan Kibutsuji, who appears at the Ubuyashiki mansion.

series.title: Reacher
series.description: Itinerant former military policeman Jack Reacher solves crimes and metes out his own brand of street justice. Based on the novels by Lee Child.

episodes.title: Welcome to Margrave
episodes.description: Jack Reacher, recently discharged from the Army, travels to Margrave, GA where he discovers that the idyllic town is a cesspool of corruption. After it becomes personal, he vows to burn it down.

episodes.title: First Dance
episodes.description: When more victims are discovered, Reacher attempts to get answers but is set up. Roscoe discovers a threatening message.

episodes.title: Spoonful
episodes.description: Reacher and Finlay's investigation leads them into a confrontation with Kliner. Roscoe learns unsettling news about Reacher.

episodes.title: In a Tree
episodes.description: As the danger increases, Reacher and Roscoe grow closer and make plans to meet their contact at Homeland Security.

episodes.title: No Apologies
episodes.description: As the mystery deepens, Reacher teams up with an old colleague and Finlay makes a shocking discovery.

episodes.title: Papier
episodes.description: While the town is rocked by another murder, Reacher heads to New York and learns the truth about the illegal business in Margrave. Roscoe faces danger in the woods.

episodes.title: Reacher Said Nothing
episodes.description: Reacher springs a trap and then gets trapped himself.

episodes.title: Pie
episodes.description: Reacher leads a rescue mission at the warehouse that ends in a showdown.

episodes.title: ATM
episodes.description: Reacher and Neagley investigate the murder of a member of 110th, a group of Special investigators assembled by Reacher, only to realize the whole unit may be at risk.

episodes.title: What Happens in Atlantic City
episodes.description: The investigation into Franz's murder takes Reacher and the surviving members of his former Army unit to Atlantic City where the mystery deepens, danger awaits, and an old flame is rekindled.

episodes.title: Picture Says a Thousand Words
episodes.description: After more of his friends fall victim, Reacher forges an uneasy alliance with a dogged detective, and their only clue in the case leads the 110th to a troubling discovery.

episodes.title: A Night at the Symphony
episodes.description: Reacher and his team head to Boston to track down a political aide with insider knowledge of a top secret military-defense contract that may be the reason behind their friends' deaths.

episodes.title: Burial
episodes.description: Neagley and Dixon discover shocking information about an old friend in Denver while Reacher and O'Donnell learn more about the nefarious and mysterious A.M.

episodes.title: New York's Finest
episodes.description: As the mystery continues to unfold, Reacher and his team set a trap to even the score.

episodes.title: The Man Goes Through
episodes.description: As the team close in on Langston, two members of the 110th face danger, compelling Reacher to devise a dangerous plan to rescue them.

episodes.title: Fly Boy
episodes.description: Reacher and Neagley make a final desperate attempt to save O'Donnell and Dixon, stop A.M. and avenge their friends' murder.

episodes.title: Persuader
episodes.description: Reacher's attempt to thwart a kidnapping brings him into contact with mysterious businessman Zachary Beck.

episodes.title: Truckin'
episodes.description: Tasked with transporting cargo for his new employer Zachary Beck, Reacher must juggle the involvement of the DEA and a nosy new associate.

episodes.title: Number 2 with a Bullet
episodes.description: As a rising body count threatens his undercover position, Reacher makes a dangerous play to secure Beck's trust.

episodes.title: Dominique
episodes.description: Reacher approaches Quinn's location and meets Duffy and Villanueva. Duffy demands to know how Reacher is connected to Quinn.

episodes.title: Smackdown
episodes.description: When a DEA tragedy puts the entire mission at risk, Reacher, Duffy, and Villanueva improvise a drastic plan to save their cover.

episodes.title: Smoke on the Water
episodes.description: Reacher struggles between wanting to kill Quinn and keeping his word to Duffy about rescuing Teresa.

episodes.title: L.A. Story
episodes.description: After Reacher and Duffy travel to Los Angeles to arrange a deal, Neagley arrives in Maine to help Reacher get answers.

episodes.title: Unfinished Business
episodes.description: Reacher, Duffy, Neagley, and Villanueva make a last-ditch effort to save Teresa and Richard and get revenge against Paulie and Quinn.

series.title: Violet Evergarden
series.description: In the aftermath of a great war, Violet Evergarden, a young female ex-soldier, gets a job at a writers' agency and goes on assignments to create letters that can connect people.

episodes.title: I Love You and Auto Memory Dolls
episodes.description: Violet is a soldier in the Leidenschaftlich Army who served under Major Gilbert Bougainvillea, who she was utterly devoted to. However, Violet is injured after a mission which resulted in the loss of her arms, requiring them to be replaced with prosthesis. Colonel Hodgins, an old acquaintance of Gilbert, arrives to pick up Violet. He explains to Violet that the war they were fighting has ended and peace has come, though he is unwilling to tell Violet what happened to Gilbert. They leave for the capital city of Leiden, where Gilbert had already arranged for Violet to be adopted by the Evergarden family. However, Violet cannot adjust to civilian life due to her military indoctrination. Hodgins then decides to show Violet his business, the CH postal company which acts as a private mail and ghostwriting service and hires her as a postal worker. She then witnesses the Auto Memoir Dolls of the ghostwriting department writing a letter for an illiterate man who wants to proclaim his love to someone. Violet then remembers that "I love you" were the last words Gilbert had told her. Wanting to know the meaning of the words, Violet asks Hodgins for her to join the ghostwriting department. Impressed that Violet has finally shown signs of acting on her own free will instead of on someone else's orders, Hodgins accepts Violet's request despite her not being an Auto Memoir Doll.

episodes.title: Never Coming Back
episodes.description: Violet joins the ghostwriting department and meets its members: the veteran Cattelya, and the two rookies Erica and Iris. Under Cattelya's direction, Violet begins her training as an Auto Memoir Doll, quickly learning how to use a typewriter. However, despite her technical proficiency, Violet is still incapable of understanding emotions. This comes to a head when she offers to write a romantic letter that ends up angering both the recipient and the client. Erica then confronts Violet about her motivations to become a Doll, but relents when Violet tells her about her desire to learn the meaning of the words "I love you." Iris suggests to Hodgins to fire Violet, but Erica comes to her defense, partly motivated due to her own insecurities about being a proper Doll. Hodgins decides not to fire Violet and gives her a new uniform, along with the brooch Gilbert had originally given to Violet, which Hodgins managed to recover. Violet is overjoyed at the return of the brooch, and agrees to attend a Doll training course. That night, Hodgins confides in Cattleya that he used to be friends with Gilbert, and that Gilbert is "never coming back".

episodes.title: May You Be an Exemplary Auto Memory Doll
episodes.description: As Cattleya advised, Violet decides to attend an Auto Memoir Doll training school. There, she meets Luculia and they start a friendship.

episodes.title: You Won't Be a Tool, But a Person Worthy of That Name
episodes.description: Violet and her work companion Iris were called to the hometown where Iris lives and discover the actual reason for her commission.

episodes.title: You Write Letters That Bring People Together?
episodes.description: After gaining some experience of working as Auto Memories Doll, Violet Evergarden went for her first important commission to a Princess who is having issues of her marriage.

episodes.title: Somewhere, Under a Starry Sky
episodes.description: Violet travels to the country of Astrea to work with transcribers copying damaged manuscripts. Her partner Leon has a past, not unlike hers.
A playwright with writer's block and a tragic past summons Violet to the country of Genetrix to help him finish a script. They both learn about grief.

episodes.title: Weapon Of War
episodes.description: As Violet searches for the Major in the present day, she recalls the time she first met him and became the terrifying weapon that turned the tide of the war.

episodes.title: Violet Evergarden
episodes.description: After realizing that Violet lost Gilbert, she assume her self to be useless but in time she found her existence to be valued by others by accepting the truth of both past and present.

episodes.title: Loved Ones Will Always Watch Over You
episodes.description: Violet goes to assist a medically ill woman whose daughter Anne assumes that she is being ignored by her mother. It isn't until later on her life she realizes what she was really doing for her.

episodes.title: I Don't Want Anybody Else to Die
episodes.description: Violet goes to assist a soldier named Aidan of the neighboring country Ctrigal which is in a state of Civil War.
Violet comes to know the rebel anti-peace faction doesn't want that the peace treaty to get signed so she helps Dietfried to stop them.

episodes.title: Auto Memoir Doll and "I Love You"
episodes.description: After the end of the war Violet tries to write down her feelings in to a letter to Gilbert as it was suggested by her co workers for the air show which was going to held after five years due to the peace achieved between the nations.

episodes.title: OVA: Surely, Someday You Will Understand "Love"
episodes.description: A story that takes place in the months between the fourth and fifth episode. Violet answers the request of a certain songstress.

series.title: Solo Leveling
series.description: Follows the adventures of Sung Jinwoo in a world that is constantly threatened by monsters and evil forces. In his battles Sung transforms himself from the weakest hunter of all mankind to one of the strongest hunters in existence.

episodes.title: I'm Used to It
episodes.description: Ten years ago, gates that connected our world to another dimension began to appear, leading to the rise of hunters who would traverse these gates to fight the magic beasts within. Sung Jin-woo, E-Rank hunter, is the weakest of them all.

episodes.title: If I Had One More Chance
episodes.description: Jin-woo and his party appear to have cleared a low-level dungeon, when a hidden path to an unfamiliar temple is revealed. There they encounter a set of commandments and a group of monsters that cause them absolute despair.

episodes.title: It's Like a Game
episodes.description: Jin-woo remains behind in the temple dungeon to save his few surviving party members, and with a swing from the god statue's blade, his life comes to an end, or so it seems, before he wakes up in a hospital bed.

episodes.title: I've Gotta Get Stronger
episodes.description: Having entered the instance dungeon located inside the subway, Jin-woo levels up time and time again by fighting waves of magic beasts. As he gradually makes his way forward, he finds a long stairway leading deeper underground.

episodes.title: A Pretty Good Deal
episodes.description: Jin-woo joins Hwang Dong-suk's party for a C-Rank dungeon. With temporary member Yoo Jin-ho, they defeat beasts. Jin-woo worries about no healer.

episodes.title: The Real Hunt Begins
episodes.description: While the C-Rank dungeon raid by Jin-woo and the others seems to be progressing well, the moment they step into an area covered in mana stones with a sleeping dungeon boss, things take a wrong turn.

episodes.title: Let's See How Far I Can Go
episodes.description: As Jin-woo continues his training, he completes a daily quest one day by doing more than the quest requires, and a key that leads to a certain item appears in front of him.

episodes.title: This Is Frustrating
episodes.description: Jin-woo answers a Hunter's Association request to take part in the raid of a D-Rank dungeon, where he encounters a few familiar faces.

episodes.title: You've Been Hiding Your Skills
episodes.description: At the D-Rank raid, Jin-woo is reunited with four of the Cartenon Temple survivors. Together, they explore the dungeon with Kang Tae-shik and his men. After splitting up, they hear a scream, and then.

episodes.title: What Is This, a Picnic?
episodes.description: Jin-woo survives tragedy once again, but Woo Jin-chul warns him that Hwang Dong-soo, an S-Rank hunter, may be after his life. Determined to grow stronger, he and Jin-ho raid a succession of C-Rank dungeons, but they attract attention.

episodes.title: A Knight Who Defends an Empty Throne
episodes.description: A surprise "job-change quest" appears for Jin-woo. Seeking strength, he accepts and enters, confronting endless foes. The final challenge, a knight, stirs memories of the Cartenon Temple.

episodes.title: Arise
episodes.description: Drained from endless battle, Jin-woo sees a phantom of his past self. To overcome his own past as the Weakest Hunter of All Mankind, he struggles to find a way to clear the job-change quest.

episodes.title: You Aren't E-Rank, Are You?
episodes.description: At Jinah's school meeting, Jinwoo is asked to speak with her classmate Han Song-yi, who has started working as a hunter. To show her the dangerous reality of the profession, he takes her to observe a White Tiger.

episodes.title: I Suppose You Aren't Aware
episodes.description: Trapped within a red gate, Jinwoo encounters a savage pack of ice elves who not only threaten his life but also taunt him about his humanity, forcing him into a deadly confrontation.

episodes.title: Still a Long Way to Go
episodes.description: Jinwoo, now more powerful after conquering 19 dungeons, returns to the treacherous S-Rank Demon's Castle. His mission to obtain rare ingredients for the Elixir of Life, a crucial step in his quest to save his ailing mother.

episodes.title: I Need to Stop Faking
episodes.description: Jinwoo realizes that he'll need to become even stronger in order to clear the Demon's Castle and decides to have his hunter rank reassessed.

episodes.title: This Is What We're Trained to Do
episodes.description: Before attempting to finish the Demon's Castle, Jinwoo decides to earn some money to help prepare.

episodes.title: Don't Look Down on My Guys
episodes.description: Jinwoo decides to help hunters guild strike team who is confronting the high orc Shaman Kargalgan which results in the epic fight.

episodes.title: The 10th S-Rank Hunter
episodes.description: Jinwoo officially becomes an S-Rank hunter, allowing him to finalize his preparations for the Demon's Castle.

episodes.title: Looking Up Was Tiring Me Out
episodes.description: Seeking the remaining ingredient for the Elixir of Life, Jinwoo continues his conquest of the Demon's Castle.

episodes.title: It Was All Worth It
episodes.description: Jinwoo tries to cure his mother with the Elixir of Life while preparations for the 4th Jeju Island Raid begin.

episodes.title: We Need a Hero
episodes.description: S-Rank hunters spar in preparation for the Jeju Island raid, honing their skills for the imminent battle against powerful magic beasts.

episodes.title: It's Going to Get Even More Intense
episodes.description: As the S-rank hunters continue fighting, they're confronted by a new magic beast resembling a humanoid ant.

episodes.title: Are You the King of Humans
episodes.description: Jinwoo arrives at Jeju Island to save the S-Rank hunters, but to do that he'll have to face the Ant King.

episodes.title: On to the Next Target
episodes.description: After no shortage of hardship, the 4th Jeju Island raid comes to a close. But for Jinwoo, the hunt never ends.

series.title: Spy x Family
series.genre: Adult Animation, Animation, Anime, Comedy, Hand-Drawn Animtion, Shonen, Thriller, Slice of Life, Spy
series.description: A spy on an undercover mission gets married and adopts a child as part of his cover. His wife and daughter have secrets of their own, and all three must strive to keep together.

episodes.title: Operation Strix
episodes.description: A spy with the new identity of Loid Forger must find and adopt a child for his next mission.

episodes.title: Secure a Wife
episodes.description: In need of a wife for the school interview, Twilight crosses with a woman who might be the right cover-up for his mission. She has secrets of her own, though.

episodes.title: Prepare for the Interview
episodes.description: To prepare for the interview, Loid, Yor and Anya set out for a day in the town, visiting various locations to prepare to sell the image of being a normal upscale family.

episodes.title: The Prestigious School's Interview
episodes.description: The Forger family goes to Eden School for the interview, where different challenges spice things up, along with the interview itself.

episodes.title: Will They Pass or Fail?
episodes.description: Anya gets excited about passing the entrance exam but wants some motivation to study, so the family and Franky go on a role play in a castle upon Anya's request.

episodes.title: The Friendship Scheme
episodes.description: Anya and Yor pick up Anya's school uniform. Later, Anya has her orientation day at Eden Academy, where Loid's Plan B to get close to Donovan via having her befriend his second son, Damien, is off on a disastrous start.

episodes.title: The Target's Second Son
episodes.description: On Anya's first day of school, Loid attempts to get her to apologize to Damien in hopes of salvaging the plan for the two to become friends. Unfortunately, Damien's conflicting feelings for Anya may get in the way of this.

episodes.title: The Counter-Secret Police Cover Operation
episodes.description: Yor's younger brother Yuri is a member of the Ostanian Secret Police, hunting spies while keeping it a secret. But when he shows up at the Forgers' residence, their secrets come face to face.

episodes.title: Show Off How In Love You Are
episodes.description: After Yuri's visit, Loid begins to suspect Yor may not be who she claims. While Loid investigates, Yor struggles with questions of her own.

episodes.title: The Great Dodgeball Plan
episodes.description: A rumor spreads among the first graders that if they do well in PE, they will be rewarded with Stella Stars. Anya is determined to get one, so she trains with Yor. Thus begins the dodgeball match between Cecile Hall and Wald Hall.

episodes.title: Stella
episodes.description: In order for parents to attend one of the social gatherings at Eden College, their children must be Imperial Scholars. Anya hates studying, so Loid comes up with a plan for her to get Stella Stars by doing community service.

episodes.title: Penguin Park
episodes.description: A trip to the local aquarium results in mayhem for the entire Forger family as Loid is assigned a mission that is, fortuitously, located in the same place.

episodes.title: Project Apple
episodes.description: The thin veneer of peace between Ostania and Westalis threatens to break when terrorists plot an assassination attempt. The Forger family is thrown into the mayhem when searching a for a dog to adopt.

episodes.title: Disarm the Time Bomb
episodes.description: Anya is saved by Yor from the terrorists she doesn't know. The intelligent dog sees future which makes the disarming of bomb very important for Anya.

episodes.title: A New Family Member
episodes.description: After being rescued by Anya and a terrorist trained dog, Loid welcomes a new member to the family, Bond, their new pet.

episodes.title: Yor's Kitchen/The Informant's Great Romance Plan
episodes.description: Believing Loid may start to see her as useless, Yor asks her coworkers to teach her to cook. Franky goes to Loid to help him ask his crush on a date.

episodes.title: Carry Out the Griffin Plan/Fullmetal Lady/Omelet Rice
episodes.description: Anya attempts to continue the Friendship Plan by helping Damian in arts and crafts, but disastrous results ensue. Sylvia meets with Loid. Yuri toughens up to survive Yor's cooking.

episodes.title: Uncle the Private Tutor/Daybreak
episodes.description: Yuri helps Anya study for her midterm exams. Afterwards, Loid breaks into Eden Academy's vaults to change her test answers but comes across an amateur spy calling himself Daybreak.

episodes.title: A Revenge Plot Against Desmond/Mama Becomes The Wind
episodes.description: George, a boy in Anya's class who believes he will be forced to leave Eden, is treated to a luxurious final day of class. Yor dashes to Eden to deliver Anya her gym clothes while Loid tails her.

episodes.title: Investigate the General Hospital/Decipher the Perplexing Code
episodes.description: Loid takes Anya to the hospital he works at for a school project. Anya spreads a hidden code to her neighbors and classmates. Franky believes a woman may finally be interested in him.

episodes.title: Nightfall/First Fit of Jealousy
episodes.description: A new spy named Nightfall joins the peacemaking team between East and West. She thinks she can play a better role as Twilight's wife and enters into a mental battle with Yor.

episodes.title: The Underground Tennis Tournament: The Campbelldon
episodes.description: Twilight and Nightfall enter an underground tennis tournament for a mission as two players and there are no rules in this match and it's a tough match.

episodes.title: The Unwavering Path
episodes.description: Nightfall and Twilight, who went to a tennis match to get a coded painting, finished their match. After this, Nightfall challenges Yor to a tennis match so that she can take the role of Twilight's wife from her

episodes.title: The Role of a Mother and Wife/Shopping with Friends
episodes.description: Yor, who thinks that she has been bested by Nightfall is upset and sad. Sensing that his mission is in jeopardy, Twilight invites Yor to a bar to talk about it. Suddenly, something happens to Twilight that hasn't happened in years.

episodes.title: First Contact
episodes.description: With his clever plan, Twilight manages to meet Desmond briefly.

episodes.title: Let's Follow Mama and Papa
episodes.description: Yor is shot in the butt while on a mission and looks miserable when she gets home. Loid mistakes her very apparent miserable mood as her being unhappy with their marriage of convenience and offers to take her out on a date.

episodes.title: Bond's Strategy to Stay Alive/Damian's Field Research Trip
episodes.description: Bond has a vision where he dies after eating food made by Yor. Worried that Damian is studying too hard during the holiday break, Emile and Ewen stay behind with Damian after the former got punished.

episodes.title: Mission and Family/The Elegant Bondman/The Heart of a Child/Waking Up
episodes.description: Yuri is doing great at his job with the Secret Police. His assignment is to investigate a former newspaper reporter suspected of selling articles slandering Ostania to Westalis.

episodes.title: The Pastry of Knowledge/The Informant's Great Romance Plan II
episodes.description: Eden's legendary dessert finally appears. In order to obtain the macrons that supposedly can make you into an Imperial Scholar if eaten, Anya and her friends race to get to them first.

episodes.title: Plan to Cross the Border
episodes.description: Yor is tasked with protecting the only survivors of the Gretcher family, Olka and her son, and helping them escape to a different country by traveling on a cruise ship.

episodes.title: The Fearsome Luxury Cruise Ship
episodes.description: After boarding the cruise ship, Yor began her duty as bodyguard to Olka and her son. Meanwhile, Yor's superior, Matthew, finds an assassin who is after Olka and her son.

episodes.title: Who Is This Mission For?
episodes.description: Loid tries to impress Anya and picks outfits to make him look like a fun dad. Meanwhile, Yor, on guard duty, is confronted by one of the assassins, Barnaby. As the attack by the assassins intensifies, Yor questions her own identity.

episodes.title: The Symphony Upon The Ship/Sister's Herbal Tea
episodes.description: Anya and Loid are enjoying the fireworks. Meanwhile, Yor's mission has reached its climax.

episodes.title: The Hand That Connects to the Future
episodes.description: Loid leaves Anya at the daycare in a hurry and then disguises himself as a State Security Service member to take care of a bomb on the ship.

episodes.title: Enjoy the Resort to the Fullest/Bragging About Vacation
episodes.description: The cruise ship arrives at the resort island, allowing the Forgers to finally enjoy a family vacation together.

episodes.title: Berlint in Love/Nightfall's Daily Life
episodes.description: Becky is very excited about a romantic drama on TV, so she heads over to the Forgers' place to see Loid, who she fell in love with instantly after seeing his picture. Becky aggressively pursues Loid.

episodes.title: Part of the Family
episodes.description: As Bond is on a walk with Loid, he has a premonition of an accident, so he tries to stop it, but is scolded by Loid. He then sees a vision of a building going up in flames and a sobbing girl standing in front of it.

series.title: One Piece
series.genre: Action Epic, Adventure Epic, Anime, Fantasy Epic, Globetrotting Adventure, Hand-Drawn Animtion, Martial Arts, Quest, Shonen, Sea Adventure
series.description: Rubber-bodied dreamer Monkey D. Luffy gathers an eclectic pirate crew and braves the perilous Grand Line, battling tyrants and monsters to claim the legendary "One Piece" and become King of the Pirates.

episodes.title: I'm Luffy! The Man Who Will Become the Pirate King!
episodes.description: Rubber-bodied rookie Monkey D. Luffy drifts out of Foosha Village in a barrel, clobbers iron-mace Alvida, liberates timid deckhand Koby, and vows to claim the legendary One Piece and crown himself Pirate King.

episodes.title: The Great Swordsman Appears! Pirate Hunter, Roronoa Zoro
episodes.description: In Shells Town, Luffy frees feared bounty hunter Roronoa Zoro from corrupt Marine Captain Morgan's clutches, gaining a swordsman crewmate and drawing Navy fire.

episodes.title: Morgan vs. Luffy! Who's This Beautiful Young Girl?
episodes.description: Luffy and Zoro battle axe-armed Captain Morgan and cowardly son Helmeppo to save Coby and a captive girl, toppling the tyrant and earning a Marine bounty on Luffy's head.

episodes.title: Luffy's Past! The Red-haired Shanks Appears!
episodes.description: On their first voyage together, Luffy recalls how red-haired pirate Shanks inspired his dream--and sacrificed an arm to save him--while Coby stays behind to join the Marines.

episodes.title: Fear, Mysterious Power! Pirate Clown Captain Buggy!
episodes.description: Luffy and Zoro arrive in Orange Town, reluctantly ally with thief Nami, and clash with body-splitting clown captain Buggy, whose devastating Buggy Balls threaten to level the city along with their Grand Line dreams.

episodes.title: Desperate Situation! Beast Tamer Mohji vs. Luffy!
episodes.description: To save Orange Town, Luffy faces beast-tamer Mohji and his giant lion Richie, while Nami slips off with Buggy's loot and an injured Zoro shields the townsfolk.

episodes.title: Souzetsu Kettou! Kengou Zoro vs Kyokugei no Cabaji!
episodes.description: Bleeding but unbowed, Zoro duels acrobat Cabaji atop Buggy's circus ruins; Luffy reassembles and launches the clown captain skyward, liberating Orange Town.

episodes.title: Shousha wa Dotchi? Akuma no Mi no Nouryoku Taiketsu!
episodes.description: Buggy reunites his body, fires a colossal Buggy Ball, but Luffy ricochets it back, wrecking the pirate's ship; Nami steals the Grand Line map and joins the voyage.

series.title: Task
series.description: In the working-class suburbs of Philadelphia, an FBI agent heads a task force to put an end to a string of violent robberies led by an unsuspected family man.

episodes.title: Crossings
episodes.description: Agent Brandis leads a new team investigating robberies while coping with personal loss. Robbie Prendergrast steals from drug dealers to support his family after his brother's death, until a tip goes wrong.

episodes.title: Family Statements
episodes.description: As Tom's family braces for an emotional court date, Robbie faces a dilemma, and Maeve makes a critical choice.

episodes.title: Nobody's Stronger Than Forgiveness
episodes.description: As Robbie and Cliff try to find a potential buyer, Tom and Grasso level with the Dark Hearts, and Aleah and Lizzie question Peaches' former coworkers. Later, a raid leads Tom to a shocking revelation.

episodes.title: All Roads
episodes.description: Tom doubts his Task Force's loyalty during operation prep. Robbie and Cliff plan their park meeting. Perry investigates the gang, finding startling info. Maeve questions Robbie's escape strategy.

episodes.title: Vagrants
episodes.description: With help from an eyewitness, Tom and his team inch closer to breaking the case. Perry pays Maeve a visit, while Robbie puts his plan in motion. Later, Tom follows a lead that takes him down a dangerous path.

episodes.title: Out Beyond Ideas of Wrongdoing and Rightdoing, There Is a River.

featured.title: How to Train Your Dragon
featured.description: As an ancient threat endangers both Vikings and dragons alike on the isle of Berk, the friendship between Hiccup, an inventive Viking, and Toothless, a Night Fury dragon, becomes the key to both species forging a new future together.

featured.title: Demon Slayer -Kimetsu no Yaiba- The Movie: Infinity Castle
featured.description: The Demon Slayer Corps are drawn into the Infinity Castle, where Tanjiro, Nezuko, and the Hashira face terrifying Upper Rank demons in a desperate fight as the final battle against Muzan Kibutsuji begins.

featured.title: Stranger Things
featured.description: In 1980s Indiana, a group of young friends witness supernatural forces and secret government exploits. As they search for answers, the children unravel a series of extraordinary mysteries.

featured.title: Gachiakuta
featured.description: In a floating city, a young boy is framed for the death of his father and exiled. He ends up in a junkyard zone, and swears to return for revenge.

featured.title: Dandadan
featured.description: When Momo and Okarun's beliefs clash, they're thrown into a world of ghosts, aliens and awakened powers.

featured.title: Ne Zha II
featured.description: After a great catastrophe, the souls of Nezha and Aobing are saved, but their bodies face ruin. To give them new life, Taiyi Zhenren turns to the mystical seven-colored lotus in a daring bid to rebuild them and change their fate.
